insight.title: Delivery Risk

status.subtitle: Delivery variability vs typical conditions
status.confidence_reason: Traffic and short-term rain outlook are available.

insight.summary: External conditions suggest delivery timing may vary with traffic and short-term rain risk.
implications: Higher delivery ETA variability can increase customer frustration and remake risk.
If conditions worsen, batching deliveries may trade speed for reliability.
supported_considerations: Consider slightly longer quoted ETAs when risk is Elevated/High.
Prioritize closer zones if conditions deteriorate.
If rain probability rises, expect slower rider availability and curbside delays.

suggested_actions.action: Add a small buffer to quoted delivery ETA
suggested_actions.why: Reduces late-delivery complaints when external variability is high.

suggested_actions.when: If traffic ratio < 0.75 or rain pop â‰¥ 0.30
suggested_actions.why: Shorter distances are less sensitive to external slowdowns.

insight.outlook: Outlook (0â€“3h): Conditions can shift quickly; re-run the pipeline closer to service.
insight.trust_note: This insight uses only external conditions (traffic/weather). No internal order data is used.
